Aion Ø´ÙˆÙ Ø§Ù„Ø¬ÙŠÙ… Ø¨Ù„Ø§ÙŠ Ø¨ØªØ§Ø¹Ù‡Ø§ Ø¹ Ø§Ù„ÙŠÙˆØªÙŠÙˆØ¨

I spent a whole summer (and more) playing Silkroad Online, I was about level 30, but I understood the economy and figured out how to make gold easily (destroy level 5 bows, you get Wind Element level 2, go to Hotan and sell each for 2k, profit :D).
After I've seen how Silkroad absorbed my time, I decided never to play MMOs again ... that was until I saw Firefall, an MMOFPS, a Sci-Fi game with Jetpacks (mesh fantasy w horses w shalall, an MMO with resource gathering and very complicated weapon crafting. But the game wasn't for everybody (it was kind of a niche) so the investors kicked out the CEO (Mark Kern) and undid everything and turned it into regular boring MMO (WoW but with Guns and Jetpacks, meh).
Mark Kern is now trying to fund another MMO called Ember, the first time I paid money for a kickstarter was a fundraiser for Ember's website and forum :D
So yeah, this is my story with MMO :D

BTW to answer your question, all Korean MMORPG are almost the same, so: Silkroad Online,  Jade Dynasty, Perfect World, etc.
They are all the same to me, and are all boring :D
